poem:
### The Missing Pages

Paper trails like ghostly forests,  
files flutter lost in ether's grasp,  
a candidate without a ballot,  
democracy slipped through a clasp.  
Errors fall like autumn leaves,  
scatter on the office floor,  
a mind-bound clerk's misstep grieves  
the councils missing faithful score.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Tell us about your disastrous admin errors and worst clerical mishaps Have you ever had “just one job” and messed it up? As the NSW Liberal party deals with the fallout of a “mind-boggling” administrative error that saw it fail to submit the paperwork to run candidates in eight local councils, we asked Guardian staff to share their own worst clerical mishaps. Related: ‘Mind-boggling’ nomination failure sparks sacking of NSW Liberal party state director Richard". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Tell us about your disastrous admin errors and worst clerical mishaps Have you ever had “just one job” and messed it up? As the NSW Liberal party deals with the fallout of a “mind-boggling” administrative error that saw it fail to submit the paperwork to run candidates in eight local councils, we asked Guardian staff to share their own worst clerical mishaps. Related: ‘Mind-boggling’ nomination failure sparks sacking of NSW Liberal party state director Richard
